statement:
Let $\{e_n\}$ be an orthonormal basis for a (real or complex)
infinite-dimensional Hilbert space $\mathcal{H}$. If $\{c_n\}$ is a
sequence of (real or complex) numbers such that
$\sum \lvert c_n \lvert^2$ converges, then there is an
$x\in \mathcal{H}$ such that $x=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty} c_n e_n$, and
$c_n = \langle x,e_n \rangle$.
